title: E-mail Surveillance
description: Michael decides to set up e-mail surveillance for all company e-mail, and discovers that Jim has invited everyone over for a barbeque except him.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: It is Friday morning and it is another beautiful day in Scranton, Pennsylvania.  [sees man in a turban outside] Oh my God. Ohhh. [dials phone number] Pick up, pick up, pick up, pick up.  Oh, we have a serious problem here. [goes out onto office floor] Alright everybody, lock the doors, turn off the lights.  Pretend you're not here.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Are we in danger?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: There's no time to think about if this is real.  Just, shh, everybody. [knock at the front door]

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Michael, should I call the... [Michael waves his hands] What?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: The IT tech guy and me did not get off to a great start.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah, I tried to install it myself, but, uh, you guys have these things so password-protected...

quotes.speaker: Sadiq
quotes.text: That just means you have to enter your password.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh...

quotes.speaker: Sadiq
quotes.text: What's your password, Michael?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, umm... [looks at Post-It on computer]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Mi-

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: AH! Guh-oood.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Sorry.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Please don't do that.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Ok, I'm sorry.  What is going on in there? Why is he here?  What are you doing?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I can't tell you.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: You have to tell me.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I don't have to tell you anything.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Look, Michael, I know you don't want to have to think about this, but if something were to happen to you, God forbid, then I would need to know in order to take over.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Dwight, nothing is going to happen to me, ok?  I'm in the best shape of my life.  Look at this. [flexes his arms] Brrr!  That's strong!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yeah, but that doesn't matter, you could get a brain aneurysm-

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I'm not going get a brain-

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Or get hit by a car-

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Stop it.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Or a bus or a train. Get poisoned, fall in a well, step on a mine, choke.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Uh, oh, ok; if I step on a mine in Scranton, Pennsylvania, and die, you can have my job, ok?  Why don't you just go... away?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: There are certain things a boss does not share with his employees.  His salary, that would depress them.  His bed, it--  And I am not going to tell them that I'll be reading their e-mails.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: So how do you search?

quotes.speaker: Sadiq
quotes.text: By keyword phrase.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Try "profits".  No! Try "Michael Scott".  "Michael" "boss" and "funny". [Sadiq (IT guy) types; result pops up] Oh my God, wow!  [chuckles]  E-mail from Stanley. Stanley,  Terribly nice guy.  [reads e-mail]  "Sorry I didn't write back sooner; I can't go to the game tonight because my boss Michael is an ass and making me stay late."  Well, Stanley's an ass.  Not one of our harder workers.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Hey, what's the deal, Michael?  Why are you spying on our computers?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, no, everybody; Oscar's gone crazy!  What other ghost stories do you have for us?  That I'm a robot? [robot voice]  I will destroy everything in my path-

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Actually, it's just-

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Beep! Bop!

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Ok...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Bommmm. Bop! Onk onk.  [Tin Man voice] Oil can. Oil can.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Tin Man.  Actually we just a got a memo from IT saying you're doing e-mail surveillance.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh, what? No. That defeats the whole purpose.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: So it's true?  You have access to our e-mails?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You know what the problem is?

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: I think I do.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: The problem is that when people hear the term "big brother", they immediately think it's scary or bad, but I don't. I think, wow, I love my big brother.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: I gotta erase a lotta stuff.  A lot of stuff.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Oh hey, just so ya know, if you have a lot of sensitive e-mails, they need to be deleted immediately.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: I know.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Good. [Pam overhears]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [whispers to Jim] Hey.  Something just happened.  Dwight just told Angela that she has to deleted all of her sensitive e-mails immediately.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I know!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Hmm...

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Do you think that they're like-

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: No, right, no, no.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [humming]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Uhhh, ew, ew, ew... Maybe?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: It's like squishing a spider under a book.  It's gonna be really gross but I have to look and make sure that it's really dead.  Sooo... [to camera guys] If you guys see anything... ?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Hey, Dwight, um, my friend is kinda into these two girls that he works with.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Nice.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: One is tall and brunette, and the other one is short, and blonde, and perky, and kinda judgmental.  Who do you think he should choose?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Does he have access to their medical records?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Ummmm...

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I think one of the greatest things about modern America is the computerization of medical records.  As a volunteer sheriff, I can look up anyone's psychiatric records or surgical histories.  Yeast infections.  There are a huge number of yeast infections in this county.  Probably because we are down river from that old bread factory.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Meredith has an E-vite from Jim.  Barbeque at Jim's tonight.  Tonight?  Wonder where my e-vitation is.  Click on guest list.  Angela, Stanley, Oscar, Meredith, Phyllis, Kevin, Creed.  Must be... .[scrolls down list] No.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Hey, Angela-

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Hi.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: How's it going?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: It's ok.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Listen, are you bringing anyone to Jim's party tonight?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: No.  Are we supposed to?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: No. I mean, I don't know, I don't think so.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Hmm... [Pam reaches towards vending machine] Excuse me.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: There's always a distance between a boss and the employees.  It is just nature's rule.  It's intimidation mostly, it's the awareness that they are not me.  I do think that I am very approachable, as one of the guys.  But maybe I need to be even approachabler.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: That's pretty young.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: [to Michael]  Are you gonna eat with us?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Of course.  Hangin' with my crew, crew that I am one of.  Hangin' with my Cup of Noodles.  This is a meal in a cup.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Uh hum.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hot, tasty.  Reminds me of college.  Lived on this stuff.  Brain food.  Mmmm... You know what I really, really miss about college?  The parties.  Everybody'd go.  The athletes, the, the nerds, professors.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: The professors would go to the parties?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah!  They were the most fun.  We always invited them.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: It's true. I'm having a party.  I've got three cases of imported beer, a karaoke machine, and I didn't invite Michael.  So three ingredients for a great party.  And it's nothing personal, I just think that if he were there, people wouldn't be able to relax, and you know, have fun, and my roommate wants to meet everybody.  Because I'm pretty sure he thinks that I'm making Dwight up.  [sighs]  He is very real.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [to cameraman] What? [looks at Dwight eating a Baby Ruth] Ohhhh... Yes!  Thank you!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Question:

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: So, Dwight thinks that tonight is a surprise party for Michael.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Really? That's great.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I know.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Maybe we can get him to hide and wait somewhere.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [laughs] Oh man.  Oh, you know what, speaking of which, I was just trying to get a handle on, you know, numbers for food and stuff.  So do you think that Roy's gonna come, or...

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh, no, he can't make it.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh, ok, cool.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hey there.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Hey.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Almost quittin' time.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yup, it's, uh, four o'clock.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: One more hour.  Take care of anything you forgot to do. Hey, you know, I don't know if you have any plans tonight, but if ya don't, we could hang out.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh, um... .I can't.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You have plans.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Uh hmm, definitely.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I do, too. I do, too.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: You do?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I do, yeah. Big plans.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Because you said "do you wanna hang out"-

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Tonight, I can't do it tonight, no.  Improv class, I have improv class, hanging out with my improv buds-

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Really?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Aw, that sounds like a lot of fun.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: It's the best.  It's the best.  I would not miss it for the world.  But if something else came up, I would definitely not go.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Improv sounds great.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: It is. Ok.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Alright.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [someone coughs] What?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I think Stanley just coughed.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hey, Pam.  Do you need me to walk to your vehicular transport?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: No thanks.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Alright.  Oscar, got big plans tonight with-

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: I'm on a call.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Kevin, big man, big man, what are you doing tonight?  Where are you off to?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: My brother is in town and we are going to see the Alaska Film Festival at the Scien-

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ok, alright.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Oh.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hey, Angela, rushy, rushy.  Where you rushin' off to?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: I'm just leaving for the day.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah, well duh.  Where ya headed?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Charity.  Bake drive.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Liar!

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: No!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You are a liar.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: No, I'm not.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Dwight, oh ho, Dwight, Dwight, my loyal compadre.  You and I are hangin' tonight.  The two of us.  We are celebrating our freedom and our manhood.  You know what?  Why don't we watch that show that you've been wanting to watch, that stupid Battleship Galaxy.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Battlestar Galatica.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: That's, whatever stupid show you want-

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I can't-

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: To watch tonight

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Tonight.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: We're watching it.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Unfortunately, I've got plans. I have to go to practice.  Soccer practice.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I didn't know you played soccer, Dwight.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Clarinet.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You, too, Dwight?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Have fun tonight!  Whatever it is that you're doing, and I'll see you Monday. [to the camera]  He has no idea!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Quick announcement everybody, if I could have everybody's attention.  We do have wine in the kitchen, and, uh, there is beer available on the porch and despite what you might think, it's not all for Meredith and Kelly, so please enjoy.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Jim!  You really think this is a good idea, huh? A hide-a-key rock?

quotes.speaker: Mark
quotes.text: Hey, you must be Dwight!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: You don't work with us.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: That's because Mark's my roommate.

quotes.speaker: Mark
quotes.text: Hey, I love the Birkenstocks.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Thanks.  Yeah, I always keep an extra set in the car, for special occasions.  Jim, come here.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Uh hmm.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: When is the guest of honor coming?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh, uh, later-ish.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: He's gonna love it!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Great. [to a group of guests]  Just wanna let you guys know that we will be taking the tour like I promised-

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Hey.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Hey!  Just in time!  You wanna go on the group tour? We were just about to leave.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Definitely.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Well, the group tour is now leaving, then.  Ladies and gentlemen, just a few things that we are gonna be pointing out to you today, you will be able to see both bedrooms and, uh, if we're lucky, maybe get a chance to peek into the bathroom, who knows.  I have to remind you that flash photography is prohibited and as much as you can, please refrain from touching things. I know you might want to.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Hey, is Katy coming?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Uh, actually, I haven't talked to her in a while.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Huh, is it ok if I call her?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: We can talk about that later.

quotes.speaker: Improv Teacher
quotes.text: Ok, let's get right into it.  I need two people for the first scene.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [In Horshack voice from 'Welcome Back, Kotter'] Ooo Ooo Ooo Ooo, Mr. Cart-air, Mr. Cart-air.

quotes.speaker: Improv Teacher
quotes.text: Ok, Michael.  And... anybody?  How about Mary-Beth?  Come on. Ok, so you start us off Mary-Beth.

quotes.speaker: Mary-Beth
quotes.text: Great. [skips] La la la la la laaa...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [fake kicks in door] Boom! Detective Michael Scarn.  I'm with the FBI.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Think about this; what is the most exciting thing that can happen, on TV, or in movies, or in real life?  Somebody has a gun. [gasps]  That's why I always start with a gun, because you can't top it, you just can't.

quotes.speaker: Girl acting Pregnant
quotes.text: I'm supposed to meet my doctor here?  Have ya seen him?  He's a very angry midget.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Boom!  Freeze!  Michael Scoon, FBI.  You know what you did.  Boom! Boom! Boom! [shoots at Pregnant Girl and another actor]  Yeah, you thought that you could get away with your little ruse, didn't you?  Didn't ya!?  Well, you didn't, because I know where ya hid the diamonds.  I been on to you and your little friends for weeks.  [another actor steps in]  Boom! Boom! Boom!

quotes.speaker: Actor
quotes.text: I'm not even in the scene!

quotes.speaker: Actress
quotes.text: Again!?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Boom! Boom!

quotes.speaker: Improv Teacher
quotes.text: Stop, stop, ok, stop.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Boom! Boom!

quotes.speaker: Improv Teacher
quotes.text: You shot me, great.  Now stop.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Why

quotes.speaker: Improv Teacher
quotes.text: You can't just shoot everyone in the scene.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, if you hadn't stopped the scene, you would have seen where it was going.

quotes.speaker: Improv Teacher
quotes.text: Ok, what about the scene they set up?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Boring.

quotes.speaker: Improv Teacher
quotes.text: No, it wasn't.  No more guns.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I could of-

quotes.speaker: Improv Teacher
quotes.text: No. No. Michael, I want you to give me all the guns you have.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ok.

quotes.speaker: Improv Teacher
quotes.text: Just, I want you to get rid of all your guns and give them to me.  Great.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yehhhehh.

quotes.speaker: Improv Teacher
quotes.text: Yeeehh, ok.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Jim's bedroom.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: See, I knew we lost somebody on the tour.  It's-

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Cool... This is your desk.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: This is my desk.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Your home office?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: My home office, this is it.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Down.  You have to sit down so I can get the full effect.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Ok, sure. Will do.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Ok, wait, so that would make me [walks to side of room] like right here.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yeah, that... Yep, that feels about right.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: And Dwight would be like-

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: You know what?  Let's just leave that image out of it, because this is a happy place.  Happy thoughts, Pam.  Happy thoughts.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Umm, [gasps] yearbook!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yeah, you don't have to, ummm.  Alright, yes, that's not gonna be awkward at all.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [finds Jim's picture] Ooooohhh no!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh yeah.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: You were so dorky!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Improv Teacher
quotes.text: Freeze!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I'm in.

quotes.speaker: Improv Teacher
quotes.text: You wanna go over the rules one more time?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, no, no.  I'm looking in my wallet for money so you can tell me my fortune.

quotes.speaker: Bill
quotes.text: I promise it's worthit .  Ooo, I can see you walking out of here and you're thrilled with your reading.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What are you... [whispers to Bill]

quotes.speaker: Improv Teacher
quotes.text: Michael, what did you tell him?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Nothing.

quotes.speaker: Improv Teacher
quotes.text: Then why are his hands up?  Bill?

quotes.speaker: Bill
quotes.text: He told me he couldn't show it to me, but he has a gun.

quotes.speaker: Improv Teacher
quotes.text: Ok, let's call it a day.  Nice job, Bill.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Good, it's good.  Good work, everybody.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Angela, burger? Dog?  Havin' fun?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: I got sap on me.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Chicken, hot dog, burger.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: I'm a vegetarian.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: There is soda inside.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Guh.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: I didn't think the premium laser color copy batch would sell as well as it did.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Yeah, it surprised us all.  I'll tell you why.  Because when they--

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: I'm sorry guys; can we please not talk about paper?  There's gotta be something else we can talk about.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: I think it's alright. Jesus drank wine. [Pam overhears]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Hey Phyllis, come here for a second.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Sure.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Have you heard anything about any secret office romances?

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: You tell me.  Well, you do mean you and Jim right?  Oh God.  I am so sorry, I thought, you guys hang out all the time and you're talking all the time.  I'm sorry!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: That's ok.  It's ok.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: [smacks Ryan's hand]  Not so fast... Fire Guy.

quotes.speaker: Mary-Beth
quotes.text: How do I get to Bernie's Tavern from here?

quotes.speaker: Bill
quotes.text: Oh, don't worry.  We're all gonna carpool.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: So Bernie's, huh?  We're all going to Bernie's? [to camera]  Go to Bernie's?

quotes.speaker: Bill
quotes.text: Oh sorry, we're not going as a group, it's just a private friend who just happens to know all of us from different ways is throwing a private birthday thing.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Right, right, right.  Well guys, I'd love to go to Bernie's with you, but, you know, I have an office party.  A big office party I need to go to, so...  Can't get out of it.

quotes.speaker: Bill
quotes.text: Ok.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ok, see you later.  Nice job, Bill.  Not.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: [singing] Here I go again on my own.  Going down the only road I've ever known...

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh by the way how's your side project going?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh, yeah I gave that up.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Really?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yeah, it turns out I was, um, just grasping at straws.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Just because two people are hanging out, it doesn't mean that they're together,  you know?  Like people can just be friends.  And I think that it was really unfair to think that there was anything else going on.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: [singing]  Just turn around now, cause you're not welcome anymore.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Surprise! [laughs]  Everybody!

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Dwight...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Wow!  Who opened the morgue for this thing?  I'm just driving by, thought I'd drop in.  [to Jim] There's some wine. I would love a glass, if you're gonna open it.  Here ya go Temp, take my jacket!  [sees Sadiq] Oh, come on! That guy?  He is a good guy, not a terrorist.  Karaoke, I love it!  I am a karaoke fiend.  I call dibs. I got next, I got next up.  Come on, let's get this party started, ha! Ok?  Where's that wine?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ok, yeah, this is a duet, so, need somebody else, Pam?  You wanna come up and sing this one?  Need somebody else.  Takers, please.  [singing]  Baby when I met you there was peace unknown. Kelly?  Tried to get you with a fine tooth comb.  I was soft inside, there was something goin' on.  This part goes to the, uh, girl.  You do something to me that I can't explain.  Hold me closer and I feel no pain.  In every beat of my heart, we got something goin' on.  Tender love is blind--

quotes.speaker: {michael} and {jim}
quotes.text: [singing] It requires a dedication, all this love we feel needs no conversation.  Divided, together, uh huh.  Making love with each other, uh huh.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: We're making love!

quotes.speaker: {michael} and {jim}
quotes.text: [singing] Islands in the stream, that is what we are, no one in between, how can we be wrong?  Sail away with me...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Talk! Just talk!

quotes.speaker: Mary-Beth
quotes.text: I am-

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Shut up!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Funny story:

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: [Oscar shakes his leg] You're going to have to stop that. [Oscar moves over] I can still feel it.

quotes.speaker: Sadiq
quotes.text: Do you have a question or something?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Um...

quotes.speaker: Sadiq
quotes.text: About my turban, maybe?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Nope, nope.  I actually wear a turban sometimes.  Wanna see it?

quotes.speaker: Sadiq
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Got it right here. [pulls out Karnak turban]

quotes.speaker: Sadiq
quotes.text: Why do you have that?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Comedy; it's funny.  It's Johnny Carson, Karnak.  It's, um, put it back.  Huhhhh, did you have Johnny Carson in your land?

quotes.speaker: Sadiq
quotes.text: In Pittsburgh?  Yeah, but I never really watched him.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh. You were forbidden.

quotes.speaker: Sadiq
quotes.text: No, I'm much younger than you.  I watched Conan.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Alright, I'm gonna, uhh, get a cup of coffee.  Do you want some coffee er-

quotes.speaker: Sadiq
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Or some tea or hummus or something?

quotes.speaker: Sadiq
quotes.text: No, thank you.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Oh, this isn't good.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: It's fine.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: You don't even know what I'm talking about.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Should have done this a long time ago.  Tons of personal e-mails, huge time wasters.  Uh, uh huh.  Wow, like Kevin, rating the best bars in Scranton?  Poor Richard's number seven?  Idiot.  Stupid load.  [phone rings]  Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Hey, Michael, accounting needs your approval on-

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah, I'm busy right now. [hangs up]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Here's a helpful suggestion for Jim.  Jim, instead of e-mailing Amazon, to try and get that CD that you didn't receive, I suggest that you go to Visa and tell them to cancel the charge.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yeah, definitely didn't need help with that, but, yeah.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: It's seems like ya did though-

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Jim.  Lots of e-mails to Amazon, lots of wasted computer space.  Alright, let's get back to work.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Yeah, I assumed Michael was already doing this.  That's why I only use my personal e-mail account.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [moves chair to Jim and Dwight's desks] Ooo, bleh bleh bleh.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Where's your tie?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I don't know.  Just felt like taking it off.  Man, work can be just so damn frustrating don't ya think, Jim?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Uh, yeah, I guess.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: What's going on, Michael.  Talk to me.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I don't know, same old stuff.  Same old.  Boss just been ridin' my ass.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Oh no! Jan!?  What's goin' on?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I don't wanna talk about it.  I just wanna hang out, just be one of the guys.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: The most important one of the guys.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: That's not the point.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: That's exactly the point.  You've hit a slump. It happens to the best of us.  You just have to remember, you know-

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Where you come from, and who you are.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ok.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: You know, you have worked so hard for this.  You are the boss; you can buy and sell us with just a snap of your little finger.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ok yes, I would never do that.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yeah, no one can snap with their little finger.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ha.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Jim, this is hardly the time.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, this is completely the time, this is perfect time.  This is just guys gently ribbing each other, it's what it's all about, just hangin' out.  Enjoying friends, all being the same.  Worker bees.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: And their king bee.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, just bees, just bees hanging out, buzzing around.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Master bee.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I'm not a master bee.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Queen bee.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I'm just a bee, Dwight, ok, just a bee, just buzzin'.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Hi!

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: Hey babe.  Hey, how are you!?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Good.

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: You look good.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: Hey, um, I was wondering if it'd be ok if I go to Lonny's poker game tonight.  I promise, it'll be like the last time for a while.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: We were supposed to go to the barbeque at Jim's house.

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: Oh, man.  Um, could you go without me? Make something up, say I like, ate something, or...

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Uhh...

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: Huh, huh?  You're the best.  You're the best!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I might be late.

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: Ok, don't wake me up cause I'm playing ball in the morning.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Ok.

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: Alright, bye. [Pam looks around the office]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [to the cameraman] Did I miss anything?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Five o'clock.  Time to go get my improv on. [drinks]  Little bit of the comedy juice.  Mmm.  Alright, see if you can guess what this is. [roars and flails his arms]  That is a dinosaur getting ready to go to improv class.  Just a taste of the improv.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I need to know... who shot Johnson!

quotes.speaker: Mary-Beth
quotes.text: Uh, President Johnson.  Um-

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Shut up!

quotes.speaker: Mary-Beth
quotes.text: Ok.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I have a right mind to shoot you right in the head.

quotes.speaker: Mary-Beth
quotes.text: I, I killed him. You're right! It was me!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Just shut up!  I don't wanna hear anything more from you.

quotes.speaker: Improv Teacher
quotes.text: No, listen to what she's saying.

quotes.speaker: Mary-Beth
quotes.text: Alright, I'll be quiet if we can make some kind of deal.  A deal?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Pow! Pow! Pow! Pow!  No deal.  Not with Michael Scarn, FBI.  Michael Scarn doesn't make deals.  Michael Scarn shoots and then asks questions later. [blows on his fake gun]

quotes.speaker: Improv Teacher
quotes.text: Good, good.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: She was kind of tripping me up, cause she was, um, I was trying to get something going, when I was over her with the gun, and she like kept changing the story.

quotes.speaker: Mary-Beth
quotes.text: I don't think... he was saying-

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, you kept-

quotes.speaker: Mary-Beth
quotes.text: He kept saying "shut up"-

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Going into nuclear something; that's not where the scene was going.

quotes.speaker: Mary-Beth
quotes.text: I-

quotes.speaker: Bill
quotes.text: It goes wherever.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, it goes, it goes in the best direction, and that was not the best direction.

quotes.speaker: Mary-Beth
quotes.text: I felt like he was ordering me around, cause he-

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, he, Michael Scarn, that character, orders people around, and that's, you should of just gone-

quotes.speaker: Improv Teacher
quotes.text: All your characters order people around though, and-

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well...

quotes.speaker: Improv Teacher
quotes.text: There's stronger choices.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I don't think there's any stronger choice than being a really strong character.

quotes.speaker: Mary-Beth
quotes.text: We've seen you do that character before though.  I mean, you know, that's cool.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Well, it's, like, well, it's, you know, when refine it, refine a character down to its essence,  that's...

quotes.speaker: Mary-Beth
quotes.text: Like Jim Carrey or something.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Exactly, thank you.

quotes.speaker: Mary-Beth
quotes.text: Right, well I wasn't saying that-

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I appreciate that.

quotes.speaker: Mary-Beth
quotes.text: Nah, I know, I just meant that... he shot me, I just-

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Or Ryan Stiles, something like that.

quotes.speaker: Mary-Beth
quotes.text: Yeah, ya know maybe, he made me get on the ground, and I didn't feel safe in this game.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You shouldn't have been, 'cause you were dealing with Michael Scarn.  That was exactly what I was hoping to achieve, so that is probably the best thing you could have said, that's a compliment.

quotes.speaker: Improv Teacher
quotes.text: You succeeded.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Good work.

quotes.speaker: Mary-Beth
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: And in this room here, if you look closely, you will find out a few clues about who lives here.  Um, he likes biking, obviously, and uh, what else?  Uh, he likes tour guides, I guess.  And if you're very perceptive, you'll notice that he didn't do a great job of cleaning his room [kicks water bottle under bed].  Ok, and uh, that's the tou-

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: And he's really into penguins or something?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Um, thank you, Ryan, uh, I don't know, I think I made the mistake one day of telling someone that I like penguins, and here we are.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Oh, I'm sorry.  I gave you a penguin.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: And that's why it's on my desk, Phyllis; it means a lot to me, and now that I know it was from you, it means even more.  Moving on!  Uh, ok, so that's the end of the tour for now, and if you liked it please tell your friends:

quotes.speaker: Improv Teacher
quotes.text: Ok, for the next exercise, let's everyone pair up.[everyone picks a partner] And everyone got somebody?  Ok, good. [Michael is partner-less] Uh, ok, uh, why don't you go out in the hallway and go through all the rules in your head.  Ok, you take a break and sort of run through the rules in your head.  Ok, stay there.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I'll just throw out some suggestions.

quotes.speaker: Improv Teacher
quotes.text: Ok, you guys wanna start? [to Michael]  Don't throw out any-

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: They're in a whorehouse.

quotes.speaker: Improv Teacher
quotes.text: Suggestions.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: And he's a proctologist. [to teacher] What?

quotes.speaker: Improv Teacher
quotes.text: We don't need a suggestion for this one; it's gonna come from them. [to other students] It's a game called "Yes, and?" and uh, you will say the first sentence.  And uh, you're telling a story-

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: First sentence is:

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Why don't you turn it up? [Ryan moves to turn up the grill]  Uh! Not so fast... Fire Guy.  Think we need some more heat, Fire Guy?  Hey, Fire Guy, maybe we should burn Jim's house down.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: That's really funny.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Hey, Kelly; I called him Fire Guy.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Good one, Kev.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Yeah... hey Stanley-

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: He called me Fire Guy.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: Oh, good one. [laughs]

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: It never gets old.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Never gets old.
